thread.title: Blue Jays’ playoff tickets command sky-high prices, home and away
thread.title_full: Blue Jays’ playoff tickets command sky-high prices, home and away | Toronto Star

author: Peter Edwards
title: Blue Jays’ playoff tickets command sky-high prices, home and away
text:
You can buy a boatload of big screen TVs for the cost of high-end Blue Jay playoff tickets.
In Toronto, that’s a really big boatload.
In rival Kansas City, it’s just a pretty big boatload.
Don’t expect to find any bargains if you scan TicketLiquidator , Craigslist or any other online ticket market.
Also, you’ll have to hold your breath that you’re buying a real ticket.
For Game 1 in Kansas City today, resale prices on TicketLiquidator ranged from $76 for nosebleeds to $1,890 Row A and $1,259 to park yourself in a dugout box.
To get to breath the air at Game 2 at Kauffman Stadium on Saturday, you’ll pay anywhere from $92 for standing room to $783 for a seat in the fourth row, on TicketLiquidator.
Things get pricier if you head to Game 3 Monday at Rogers Centre, where it’s $157 for the cheapest possible seat to $2,155 to get you into Row AA.
Game 4 Tuesday in Rogers Centre is about the same, with tickets on TicketLiquidator starting at $152 and rising to $2,222 in AA.
If you have aspire to watch the game from a VIP suite, you’ll have to clear $18,000 room on your credit card.
For Game 5 Wednesday at the Rogers Centre, prices start on TicketLiquidator at $156 and max out at $2,700 per seat in the AA section.
Game 6 Fri., Oct. 23 in Kauffman Stadium will cost you $162 on TicketLiquidator for a single standing room spot and $4,455 to share the pain or glory in the dugout box.
And, if the series goes to a Game 7 on Sat., Oct. 24 in Kauffman Stadium, it’ll cost you $162 on TicketLiquidator for standing room, $2,696 in Row A and $4,046 for a dugout box.
